intro: Wyethia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf wyethia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
